snippet: The vote by the ruling party in Khyber-Pakhtunkhwa Province was in response to a C.I.A. missile strike that killed a Pakistani Taliban leader Friday.
abstract: Tehreek-e-Insaf, ruling party in a northwestern province of Pakistan, votes to block NATO supply lines by Nov 20 unless the United States stops its drone strikes in the nearby tribal belt; vote comes in response to a CIA missile strike that killed Hakimullah Mehsud, leader of the Pakistani Taliban.

byline.original: By DECLAN WALSH and ISMAIL KHAN
byline.contributor: Declan Walsh reported from London, and Ismail Khan from Peshawar, Pakistan.

lead_paragraph: The vote by the ruling party in Khyber-Pakhtunkhwa Province was in response to a C.I.A. missile strike that killed a Pakistani Taliban leader Friday.

headline.main: Pakistani Party Votes to Block NATO Supply Lines if Drones Persist
headline.print_headline: Pakistani Party Votes to Block NATO Supply Lines if Drones Persist
